archetype_name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
name: Cashew Chicken Stir-Fry with Bell Peppers & Snow Peas over Jasmine Rice
description: Family-friendly wok stir-fry with tender chicken, crunchy cashews, and bright veg in a savory-sweet, medium-heat sauce. Built fast on the stovetop and served over fluffy jasmine rice.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; set aside to cook.
Trim and slice 500 g chicken thighs into bite-size strips.
Slice 1 onion and 1 bell pepper into thin strips.
Rinse 200 g snow peas and pat dry.
Sauce: In a bowl, mix 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tsp chili flakes (medium heat), 1 tsp sesame oil.
Slurry: In a small cup, mix 1 tbsp cornflour with a splash of water.
Optional quick prep: Place snow peas in a microwave-safe bowl with a splash of water and cover; set aside to microwave just before stir-frying (45–60 seconds).
cook_steps: Cook rice on the stovetop according to package directions; keep warm.
Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large skillet/wok over high heat.
Add chicken; season lightly with salt and black pepper. Stir-fry until just browned (3–4 min). Transfer to a plate.
Add 1 tbsp canola oil to the pan. Stir-fry onions and bell pepper until crisp-tender (2–3 min).
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Return chicken and any juices to the pan. Stir the sauce, pour it in, and bring to a simmer (30–60 seconds).
Stir the cornflour slurry and drizzle in while tossing until the sauce thickens and coats (30–60 seconds).
Microwave the snow peas (45–60 seconds) and drain, or add them directly to the pan; toss for 1 minute to keep them crisp.
Scatter 1/2 cup cashews; toss to combine. Taste and adjust with extra soy sauce or chili flakes for heat.
Fluff rice and serve stir-fry on top. Garnish with sliced spring onion if desired.
